monogr.title: The making, description, and vse of a small portable instrument for ye pocket (or according to any magnitude) in forme of a mixt trapezia thus called a horizontall quadrant : composed and prodused soly for the benefit and vse of such which are studious of mathematicall practice Written and delivered by Delamain, student and teacher of the mathematickes
monogr.author: Delamain, Richard
monogr.extent: 18, 104 pages, 4 leaves of plates, illustrations, table, 8Â°

div.p: MVch more I might have laid open upon the use of this Instrument, as the making of Horizontall, direct, declining, cilindrical, & Ring dyalls, the distance of the houres, substiler & stiles hight, Stoflerius Astrolabe, Master Gunters Quadrant, with many other Instruments, now used, but let these be sufficient for the present; the ingenious, may easily adde vnto that which I have delivered, & therefore I shew first how to project the Instruments, then the Description, and lastly how these uses, are compendiously contracted, and operated.
